column5: Snuck down to the river this morning while everyone was still asleep.After only catching a few bass all week my hopes were not high.Here are some pics of what was waiting for me.      After 2 hours of sitting and waiting I was ready to head home and have breakfast.I said to myself just one more cast.I cast as far out as I could to a new spot and within 30 seconds my line takes off.After a week long drought I finally have a carp on again.This fish went straight through both pools,out into the fast moving water and tried to get around the island in the middle of the river.Seeing this I put the brakes on him and held him.With him wanting to run combined with the fast moving water it felt like trying to reel in freight train.I finally coax him back to the hole in front of me and finally get a glimpse of him.Here is a pic I took while still fighting him,glad I did.  As I reached down to grab him he makes one last run and hear my line snap.He sat in the shallows right in front of me for a bit then took off,so no more pics.Time to get a net to avoid losing them at the shore.It has been a really slow week so just getting to fight something again was good.
Nice man, glad to hear you located em and started getting them again, thanks for the pics
nice pic to bad it got away on ya. Next time though.
Glad to hear you're back into the fish.  You gotta get a net to land more of those powerful carp.  007
man those carp are damn ugly.  Nice report though
Great report.  Love those scenery shots, not so much the slimey, scaley creature tho  Joey
C'mon. It's just a bass with botoxed lips.  JF
I learned my lesson about a net the hard way with a nice steelhead this past spring!!  Great report and congrats on your first carp in a week!  Great pics as usual.
Oh I remeber that report now because of Cliff I try not to forget the net lol .MTP
